means: <宗>（最后审判日）所有死者的复活

sentence.Network_en: This is a resurrection of an old story from the mid-70s.

sentence.Network_en: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Christ from the death.
sentence.Network_cn: 基督教徒们庆祝耶稣基督的复活.

sentence.Network_en: Some resurrection of domestic price pressure was apparent in the early part of the year.
sentence.Network_cn: 年初,一些源自本地的价格压力明显重现.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin resurrectio(n-), from the verb resurgere 'rise again' (see resurgent)

entry.def: In Christian belief, the Resurrection is the event in which Jesus Christ came back to life after he had been killed.
